name: Mini Explorer Trail and Brass Rubbing, Hardy Monument

ai.summary: A short, easy 2.4 km hike in the UK that combines the Mini Explorer Trail with a brass rubbing stop at the Hardy Monument. Suitable for families, beginners, and anyone seeking a quick outdoor outing with a touch of history.
ai.terrain_summary: Predominantly flat, well-surfaced paths with gentle gravel and compact earth. The route has minimal elevation change, but some portions near the brass rubbing area may be uneven; wear supportive footwear.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for typical UK weather and wear sturdy shoes. Stay on marked paths and observe posted signs; be mindful of pedestrians and nearby road crossings near the monument. Respect private property around the brass rubbing site and follow any site rules for rubbing activities. Carry water, a light layer for changeable weather, and a small flashlight if visiting near dawn or dusk. If accessibility is a concern, verify that the route suits your needs before setting out.
ai.best_seasons: Spring and autumn are ideal due to mild temperatures and pleasant conditions; summers are fine for longer daylight hours, while winters can be muddy and less comfortable.
